title: 15-year-old boy shot in Paterson on Wednesday night
content:
PATERSON – A 15-year-old boy was shot in the torso Wednesday night, police said.
Paterson police responded to a report of shots being fired in the area of Keen Street and Rosa Parks Boulevard at approximately 10:15 p.m. Wednesday, but did not immediately find any victims, Police Director Jerry Speziale said.
A few minutes later, the officers were sent to the area of Governor and Carroll streets to locate a shooting victim in the area, Speziale said. The officers found a 15-year-old boy who had a “graze wound to the torso,” he said.
The boy was sent to St. Joseph’s Regional Medical Center and is in stable condition, Speziale said.
Police believe the boy was in the area of Keen Street when multiple shots were fired and was struck, Speziale said. It appears he fled the scene and was then located by the officers near Governor Street.
Paterson police are investigating the shooting, Speziale said, and the department is asking anyone with information to call 973-321-1242.
